conclusion: An equilateral triangular conductor frame ABC is placed in a magnetic field pointing into the page, with points A and B connected to a power supply.
The frame is made of uniform resistance wires and is perpendicular to the magnetic field. The Ampere force on segment AB is F, and the task is to find the resultant force on all three segments.
Current flows through all three segments: directly from A to B along AB, and from A to C to B along AC and CB, due to Kirchhoff's current law.
Force on segment AB is given as F, directed upward, perpendicular to the current and magnetic field.
Force on segment BC is F/2, directed upward and to the left at 60° from vertical, due to half the current and same length as AB.
Force on segment CA is F/2, directed upward and to the right at 60° from vertical, due to half the current and same length as AB.
The horizontal components of forces on BC and CA cancel each other out due to symmetry.
Total vertical component of the resultant force is F + F(√3/4) + F(√3/4) = F(1 + √3/2).
The magnitude of the resultant Ampere force on the three resistance wires is F(1 + √3/2), approximately 1.866F.
